pageContext.claim: “As you know, we used to pay the Palestinians $750 million a year, and I ended that some time ago, on the basis that they didn't seem to want to make peace.”
pageContext.analysis: A Congressional Research Service report from 2018 says the U.S. provided $496 million in aid for Palestinians in 2012. The amount of aid steadily declined during Obama's second term. In Fiscal 2019, the U.S. provided $250 million in aid, according to the report. The figure grew to $800 million in 2016 when factoring in direct aid to the Palestinian Authority and the United Nations' Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees, according to Haaretz. Either way, Trump's number is way off. Trump has sharply reduced aid to the Palestinians but U.S. assistance has not been entirely eliminated.
